item.title: Damaged brick paving a severe trip hazard, 18th December
item.description:
The brick paved sidewalk running alongside the bridge over the A2 has two bricks misplaced with one set very proud right in the middle of the walkway, creating a dangerous trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Well Hall, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Bus Station - Damage to road or pavement within the Bus Station

item.title: Deep pot holes collecting water on pavement, 18th December
item.description:
Deep pot holes and sunken pavement, the public path along the rail track. Water collects making it impossible to pass for the disabled and pushchair users as the only option to avoid it is by climbing the slippery sloped verge full of mud. Been like this for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longfield Crescent, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car with hidden registration number, 18th December
item.description:
Deliberate paint over the reg plate. Looks suspicious. Untaxed ? Car has not been moved for over a week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royston Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation near Kentish Road X bus stop, 18th December
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation alongside the pavement by Kentish Road X bus stop. Has been like that for years, meaning we have to walk in the road after getting off bus to walk down Picardy Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kentish Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Sofa on the pavement
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Walm Lane, London

item.title: Abandoned bike, 18th December
item.description:

item.title: Shrubbery obstructing pavement, 18th December
item.description:
Shrubbery growth obstructing pavement for years. Difficult to define whether in garden of 61 Abbey Road end of fencing as you walk down Ripley Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ripley Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working out side number 66 and64, 18th December
item.description:
I am disabled and have already had a fall down the steps outside my house . Plus my car has. Been broken into for disabled badge twice .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Parkdale Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Sheridan Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Road, Beckenham, Greater London

More graffiti in this area. Another tag on wall this time next to Tesco

item.title: Shopping trolley (reported elsewhere on site) filled with rubbish, 18th December
item.description:
This trolley has been here for weeks and is attracting bags of litter added at different times
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ripley Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Red barrier where the street lights are down sticking out in the road and difficult to see as no street lights, 18th December
item.description:
Red barrier near the sleeping policemen which are down sticking out into the road unsecured as are the emergency cones that are there. Very difficult to see especially in this weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Birdpoo AGAIN on wooden bench., 18th December
item.description:
The tree above this seat needs cutting back as the birds continuously poo on the seat. Making it totally UN sitable This is the 3rd time it’s been cleaned. Please move the seat to somewhere away from tree.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Westmoreland Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple street lights out of order, 18th December
item.description:
There’s around 4-5 street lamps which are not working along the path which makes the area very dark to walk through, causing potential tripping hazards and it feels unsafe to walk there. The path is used by commuters, dog walkers and for leisure purposes
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenesk Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant flytipping, 18th December
item.description:
Rubbish is dumped here almost every week. As soon as it’s cleared more appears. Please do something to stop it permanently. Maybe plant a garden or put planters

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Crewdson Road, Oval, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12" round pothole,,deep with sharp edges in normal path of cyclists, 18th December
item.description:
Pothole deep and sharp enough to burst my tyres and break a wheel. In normal path for cyclists. Lucky to stay upright but had to abandon riding and walk broken bike home. Could be very dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wood Vale, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
